commit.message: Fix connect() error detection (GH-163)

Do not try to reuse ddpy fbconfig (fixes GH-160)

Since now the fbconfig is created with respect to application-supplied dpy
rather than always-open primus.ddpy, do not cache it to avoid using it after
the application has closed the dpy connection.

Revert back to using compiler support for ifuncs (GH-153)

Designating ifuncs via top-level asms is miscompiled with LTO in all GCC
releases so far, since LTO partitioning can put the asm and the function
definition in different partitions.  Though LTO is not useful for primus,
prefer avoiding breakage to supporting building with old (<4.6) GCC.

This reverts commits 3cc169b3 and 38731d53.
Defer glXChooseFBConfig from library constructor to first use (GH-151)
Remove some of the remaining uses of primus.ddpy
Avoid using primus.ddpy in match_visual (GH-132)
Avoid using primus.ddpy in match_fbconfig

Reuse initial ddpy if XOpenDisplay fails in display thread

Chromium renderer sandbox prevents opening new sockets after constructors have
run.  As a result, XOpenDisplay will fail in display threads.  In that case,
try to reuse initial connection: this is extremely fragile, but seems a bit
better than failing altogether.

Chromium discussion: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=351804
pass any preprocessor flags defined by environment to gcc

Merge pull request #142 from andreas-schwab/master

Fix compilation on arm by adjusting asm ifunc directive

Fix compilation on arm

Use % in .type directive since @ is a comment character on arm

Perform readback from the front buffer (GH-92, GH-110)

Looks like glXSwapBuffers for multisampled pbuffers is not a swap, but rather
a back-to-front copy.  Lack of a GPU fence following glReadPixels causes the
readback and the application race, manifesting as flickering.

Reading from the front buffer does not appear to have negative effect with
nVidia drivers.

Try to save power by sleeping before glMapBuffer

The expectation here is that glMapBuffer spends most of the time busy waiting
for pixel data arrival, so try to sleep for most of the waiting time instead.
Since we can't know how much time glMapBuffer time is going to take, use the
time from the previous frame and sleep for a fixed fraction of that (90% by
default).

Implement PBO glDrawPixels upload/display path

Should be more efficient on i965 with Mesa-10.1+
Warn if drawable is not current to glXSwapBuffers thread
Correct condition for restarting workers on context change

Use GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE instead of GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV

Together with the previous commit, this allows glTexSubImage to hit fast
texture upload path in i965 driver in Mesa 10.0 and 9.1 (not 9.2, which
switched to Y-tiled textures, but fast upload was not ready for that).
Switch back to GL_TEXTURE_2D to enable i965 fast upload
Avoid recreating pbuffers when size doesn't change (GH-120)
Allow glXQueryDrawable on unknown windows (fixes GH-121)
Report sizes in perf output
Remove Profiler::nstates
Factor out Profiler::get_timestamp

Flush the application X connection in glXSwapBuffers

Otherwise there may be no other activity on the connection and application
requests such as resize may be never flushed out.  Fixes CoherentUI
Use caller-supplied dpy in glXCreate*
Use caller-supplied dpy in glXCreateWindow (fixes GH-111)
Add GLX_ARB_create_context (GH-106; fixes GH-36)
Basic support for handling GLX extensions
Add memory ordering between todo marker and dimensions (GH-97)
Improve error reporting for broken ddpy GLX
